main event: Three unidentified moving objects were observed by multiple witnesses in Richfield, Ohio on April 4, 1956 and May 5, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were observed for 30-40 minutes on April 4, 1956, and for about 30 minutes on May 5, 1960.
The objects appeared to take off and disappear, but the observers could not determine their direction or movement.
On May 5, 1960, the object was described as a moon-shaped luminous object approximately 25-30 feet in diameter that was stationary for about 20 minutes.
The May 5, 1960 witnesses reported that Air Force jets appeared to pass directly through the center of the object before it vanished.
One witness, who was writing a book, claimed to have seen similar objects in the sky before that appeared to send down rays of light like a searchlight.
sighted object: Three unidentified moving objects, and a moon-shaped luminous object
photographs: No photographs included in the report
